results.title: With music ring
results.brief_description: Featuring the Mormon Tabernacle Choir of 375 voices. Shows how the building of a great composite sound such as the Mormon Tabernacle Choir requires hard work and a man of talent on the podium.

results.title: With just a little trust
results.brief_description: An elderly black woman, her feet swollen with arthritis, marches with pride and determination through an urban ghetto to meet her daughter. Arriving ahead of her daughter, she finds an eviction notice on the door of the apartment - only the beginning of a veritable sea of troubles which mother and daughter meet together. Cast: Frances Williams, Barbara Iley.

results.title: With gentle majesty
results.brief_description: This film recalls the hey-day of the working horse at the turn of the century, and reflects on the decreasing number used today. The title is from Shakespeare’s lines: “Sometimes he trots, as if he told the steps, with gentle majesty and modest pride”. Narrated by Wynn Roberts. (Award: AFI Silver Award)

results.title: Wirritt Wirritt
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian National Film Board and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: The aboriginal legend of how fire came under man’s control, illustrated by aboriginal cave painting. The musical background was recorded in Arnhem Land by Professor Elkin. The story is that at first only one man could make fire, and jealously guarded it. However, by a trick Wirritt Wirritt (an ancestral hero) stole the secret for all men’s use. Narrated by Ray Barrett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, Australian National Film Board and Australian news and Information Bureau

results.title: Wireless nights
results.creator_credit: Melissa Juhanson, Chris McGill and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Each night from midnight to dawn Melbourne’s night owls and insomniacs tune their radios to the voice 3AW’s Keith McGowan. “Wireless nights” explores the richness and drama of this unique group of people, self-named “The Overnighters”, as they share their lives across the airwaves.

results.title: Wireless nights
results.brief_description: For older lonely people, talk back radio is both a solace and a connection to the wilder world. This luminous documentary concentrates on people’s faces and the living rooms, kitchens and bedrooms in which they live to create a blessedly humane mediation on age, loneliness and technology.

results.title: Wire sculpture
results.brief_description: An exploration into the design and construction of “kinetic” sculpture with steel wire and acetylene torch. Joe Police, a freelance artist, constructs a movable sculpture of a human head. He relates his experiences in learning his craft and comments on his philosophy of art and creativity. The film is complimented by Peter Coraggio’s “Electronic Sound Sculpture”.

results.title: Wipe Out the Jargon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: The characters in this madcap program (a pen, a pencil and liquid paper) spearhead an attack on jargon and woolly-writing. They demonstrate how to improve letter and report writing skills by isolating the four principles of clear, well structured letters and reports: Be clear, Order, Evaluate. Short notes accompany the program.
